channel.title: Baosen Zhang
channel.description: Baosen Zhang is an Assistant Professor in the Electrical Engineering Department at the University of Washington.

item.title: Best Papers in Power and Energy General Meeting and ACE E-Energy
item.description:
PES GM, Best Conference Papers on Power System Planning, Operation, and Electricity Markets

  1. A. Ademola-Idowu and B. Zhang, “Optimal Design of Virtual Inertia and Damping Coefficients for Virtual Synchronous Machines,” in Power and Energy Society General Meeting, 2018.
    • BibTeX
      • @inproceedings{Tinu18,
  title = {Optimal Design of Virtual Inertia and Damping Coefficients for Virtual Synchronous Machines},
  author = {Ademola-Idowu, A. and Zhang, B.},
  year = {2018},
  booktitle = {Power and Energy Society General Meeting},
  link = {http://arxiv.org/abs/1806.08488},
  blog = {2018-6-21a}
}
    • Download

PES GM, Best Conference Papers on Power System Stability, Control, and Protection

  1. J. E. Contreras-Ocana, U. Siddiqi, and B. Zhang, “Non-Wire Alternatives to Capacity Expansion,” in Power and Energy Society General Meeting, 2018.

      • @inproceedings{CO18,

}

ACM E-Energy, Best Paper Finalist

  1. P. Li, S. Sekar, and B. Zhang, “A Capacity-Price Game for Uncertain Renewables Resources,” in Proceedings of ACM E-Energy, 2018.

item.title: Paper on Using Generative Adversarial Networks for Scenario Generation
item.description:
Scenario generation method using Generative Adversarial Networks, code available here.

  1. Y. Chen, Y. Wang, D. Kirschen, and B. Zhang, “Model-Free Renewables Scenario Generation Using Generative Adversarial Networks,” IEEE Transaction on Power Systems, 2018.
    • BibTeX
      • @article{Chen17,

  journal = {IEEE Transaction on Power Systems},

}

item.title: Paper on Using Battery Storage for Multiple Grid Applications in IEEE Transaction on Power Systems
item.description:
